title: How to Remove Chewing Gum from Concrete

steps.headline: Rub an ice cube on the chewing gum.
steps.description: Put the ice cube in a plastic bag so that you have a better grip of it. Continue rubbing until the gum hardens.

steps.headline: Use a putty knife to scrape off the hardened gum.
steps.description: Scrape as much gum as you possibly can without damaging the concrete.

steps.headline: Apply denatured alcohol directly on the remaining gum.
steps.description: Saturate the gum with the alcohol and let it sit for about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Scrape the remaining chewing gum using a metal scraper.
Mix 1/2 tablespoon of liquid dish-washing detergent with 1 cup of hot water in a small bowl to make a detergent solution.
Dip a stiff bristle brush on the soap suds and gently scrub the rest of the gum residue from the concrete.
Rinse the affected area thoroughly with clean water.

text: Rub an ice cube on the chewing gum. Put the ice cube in a plastic bag so that you have a better grip of it. Continue rubbing until the gum hardens. Use a putty knife to scrape off the hardened gum. Scrape as much gum as you possibly can without damaging the concrete. Apply denatured alcohol directly on the remaining gum. Saturate the gum with the alcohol and let it sit for about 5 minutes. Scrape the remaining chewing gum using a metal scraper.  Mix 1/2 tablespoon of liquid dish-washing detergent with 1 cup of hot water in a small bowl to make a detergent solution.  Dip a stiff bristle brush on the soap suds and gently scrub the rest of the gum residue from the concrete.  Rinse the affected area thoroughly with clean water.
